alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Oregon; Ozark; Texas; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 3:56PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas, Ozark and Wright. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain was ongoing. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Pond Fork at County Road 883 and Beaver Creek at County Road 524. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Cabool, Mansfield, Alton, Gainesville, Norwood, Hartville, Bakersfield, Dawson, Pomona, Theodosia, South Fork, Koshkonong, Pontiac, Brandsville, Huggins, Wasola, Thomasville, Sundown, Siloam Springs, Dora, Pottersville, Vanzant, Sycamore, Drury, Caulfield, Gentryville, Zanoni, White Church, Rockbridge, Clear Springs, Brixey, Tecumseh, Elk Creek and Moody. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Howell; Oregon; Ozark; Texas; Wright
